Data: Afridi to Ponting, no run a fraction short, and cut hard to point. Well stopped
Afridi to Ponting, 1 run tossed up, and driven compactly to cover
Afridi to Haddin, no run devious through the air, and zipping into a defensive push outside off
Afridi to Haddin, no run blocked solidly on off stump
Afridi to Haddin, no run the blade turns in the hands but midwicket tidies up. No angles for Australia to work with yet
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run pushed firmly to cover. Pakistan in complete command at the moment. But they'll like a few wickets for their pressure
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 run whippy delivery on off stump, Haddin jabs down into the gully and a sharp piece of fielding saves a run
Wahab Riaz to Ponting, 1 run short and pulled handsomely, off the front foot, but without a lot of power
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, FOUR runs a valuable boundary, and with fine leg up, Wahab can't really bowl there, on the hips. Enough bat to beat the field
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 2 runs on the pads again, Wahab's line isn't right just yet. A slide at square leg saves another four
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run probed into the gully
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run pushed down the track to mid-off. A bit of pressure released in that over
Afridi to Ponting, 1 run pushed into the gap to keep the strike rotating
Afridi to Haddin, FOUR runs belted, hard and straight. Not a lot of feet involved, not a lot needed. That fizzed onto the bat, and straight off again
Afridi to Haddin, no run
Afridi to Haddin, no run flighted and defended on off stump. Good bounce in that topspinner
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run sharp calling for a deflection into the gully
Afridi to Ponting, no run Australia starting to pick up the tempo now, a few quick singles making themselves available through urgent calls and calm deflections
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run a flat-footed whoosh outside off stump. Half an appeal from Akmal
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 run on the pads from Wahab, not quite the right line yet
Wahab Riaz to Ponting, FOUR runs that was a remarkable shot! Short, and badly beaten by sharp lift, and Ponting's late pull takes a fat top-edge and sails over the keeper's head for four!
Wahab Riaz to Ponting, 1 run another single to keep the strike rotating
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 wide that's a poor ball, Wahab is letting the noose slip now, with a wide down the leg side
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 run punched through point
Wahab Riaz to Ponting, FOUR runs over-pitched outside off this time, and that's Ponting at his best. Leaning into his cover-drive and piercing the field. He's getting into his stride now
Hafeez to Haddin, 1 run
Hafeez to Ponting, no run
Hafeez to Ponting, no run
Hafeez to Ponting, 1 run on the pads, turned through midwicket
Hafeez to Haddin, 1 run
Hafeez to Ponting, no run carefully prodded back to the bowler
Afridi to Haddin, no run quick and flat, sliding into Haddin who hurriedly pushed to leg
Afridi to Haddin, no run once again Haddin is full of respect, which is no common thing
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run touch more air here, Afridi tempting up outside off stump. Haddin eases into a drive to cover
Afridi to Ponting, no run huge appeal from bowler and keeper as Afridi slides one into Ponting's pads but a big, big stride prevented trouble
Afridi to Ponting, 1 run more secure here for the batsman, full-facing a single down the ground
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run googly to finish the over, plenty of overspin finds some extra bounce. Haddin is unperturbed and nudges around the corner
Hafeez to Haddin, no run tight line around middle on a length and Haddin content to push it away
Hafeez to Haddin, no run very careful from Haddin again, tapping back to the bowler
Hafeez to Haddin, no run hint of uncertainty as Haddin plays for spin that isn't there
Hafeez to Haddin, no run prodded back to the bowler again, good run of dots being built
Hafeez to Haddin, no run tossed up outside off stump, Haddin stretches across to dab back to Hafeez
Hafeez to Haddin, 1 run finally the single is taken as Haddin's flick goes wide of the bowler down to long-on
Afridi to Haddin, no run no timing here for Haddin as he slaps to point
Afridi to Haddin, no run ooh, the pressure almost told there. Attempting to run down to third man came off the bottom edge, onto the boot, very close to the stumps and almost to the keeper
Afridi to Haddin, no run this time Haddin is more secure in defence
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run Afridi is really tossing this up, clearly feels in good control and Haddin threads a single into space
Afridi to Ponting, no run ah, nothing there for Ponting. He wanted to squeeze a cut away but it was too close to him for the shot
Afridi to Ponting, 1 run nothing as ambitious this time from Ponting, instead easing his hands over the ball to flick to leg
Hafeez to Ponting, 1 run Misbah has dropped Ponting at square leg! Really hard sweep flew low to him and went straight through. Looked like a tough chance though
Hafeez to Haddin, 1 run Haddin more calmly works a single
Hafeez to Ponting, no run careful defence from Ponting, he hasn't looked safe against Hafeez at all

Hafeez to Ponting, OUT gone! Akmal has held a very good catch and Ponting has to go! Things really bubbling over here. Ponting went back to cut a ball which wasn't really there for it, got a thick edge that Akmal did well to hold. It was given not out originally, but rightly was overturned on review. While waiting for the third
Hafeez to Clarke, no run bit of spin here for Hafeez back into Clarke who prods it to leg
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run carefully defended into the off side. Looked a touch uncertain as he did, getting a leading edge
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 1 leg bye starts a touch short and down the leg side, nibbled away behind square
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run banged into the pitch short of a length. Haddin calmly stands tall to defend
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run looks like Haddin has set his stall out to bat through. Very watchful at the moment
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run much better this over from Wahab. This is his best delivery yet, good length around off stump, Haddin was hanging back and had to jab his defence away
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 run too short this time and allows Haddin to turn a single to midwicket

Wahab Riaz to Clarke, FOUR runs Clarke gets four when he so nearly could have gone! Loose shot really, aiming an airy drive to a shortish ball, flew off the inside edge close to the stumps and actually not all that far from the wicketkeeper before disappearing to the boundary
Hafeez to Haddin, no run Umar scoots around at midwicket to cut off a Haddin flick
Hafeez to Haddin, no run doosra, or possibly just one that didn't spin. Either way Haddin was very careful in defence
Hafeez to Haddin, no run ooh, Haddin advances and again is defeated by back of turn, thickish outside edge ran along the ground to point
Hafeez to Haddin, 1 run this is far safer, pushed down to long-on
Hafeez to Clarke, no run Clarke flicks firmly but straight to square leg
Hafeez to Clarke, no run the bounce and sprightliness seems to have returned to Clarke's set up at the crease. Even as he defends back to the bowler
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run Haddin wants a pop at Wahab I suspect, he's edging down the crease and winding up for a big shot but doesn't get the width he wants so only pushes back to the bowler
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 run this time there is width outside off and Haddin creams a drive to deep point
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, no run better delivery this time, back of a length around off stump. Blocked to cover
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 1 run touch too wide and Clarke flashes a cut shot out to third man
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 wide nonsense down the leg side. Doesn't look like Wahab can land six deliveries consistently
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run that's more like it from Wahab, fuller, quicker and straighter. Earns a forward block for the effort
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, 1 run Haddin gets the slightest invitation of width and dabs down to third man
Hafeez to Haddin, no run very delicate from Haddin opening the face to steer to third man. Fairly ineffective though because there is a fielder there
Hafeez to Haddin, 1 run clipped past a diving Umar at midwicket, who is disgusted with himself for missing
Hafeez to Clarke, no run good work from Hafeez pinning Clarke to the crease
Hafeez to Clarke, no run Clarke whips to leg but picks out midwicket
Hafeez to Clarke, no run ooh, flash and a miss outside off stump. Similar to the Ponting dismissal but Clarke is in form so misses. Such are the unwritten laws of the game
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run good work from Clarke here, skipping down the wicket and clipping to long-on
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 1 run too short from Wahab means Clarke can stand tall and run down to third man
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run Haddin flashes outside off stump and misses
Wahab Riaz to Haddin, no run more secure this time by Haddin, getting in line to defend under his eyes

Wahab Riaz to Haddin, OUT Wahab strikes and Australia are in trouble now! Akmal takes another catch! I between the dross Wahab has found some bounce and nibble and Haddin aimed a nothing steer to third man, got a faint edge and Kamran held on to the chance.
Wahab Riaz to White, 2 runs after the good delivery Wahab serves up an easy one on the pads for White to clip towards square leg for a couple
Wahab Riaz to White, no run this is fuller, much fuller but outside off stump and ignored by White
Hafeez to Clarke, no run Hafeez is doing a fine, fine job here. Nothing fancy, just hitting lengths and lines and nowhere for Clarke to go
Hafeez to Clarke, no run very carefully defended once more

Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run ooh, this was a very tight single. Clarke picked out Misbah at midwicket and hared off for a single. A quicker pick-up and a direct hit would have gone but as it was Clarke was safe
Hafeez to White, no run White is hanging back in his crease and looks rushed as he blocks this
Hafeez to White, no run carefully defended once more this time White got forward though
Hafeez to White, no run ooh, doosra slides past a groping, flat-footed outside edge!
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 1 wide Wahab is pounding in after his wicket and this is quick but the length and line is wrong

Wahab Riaz to Clarke, FOUR runs the shot looks risky but really from this line - wide outside off - Clarke is safe. He flashed an expansive drive off a thickish edge that flew past the slip to the third-man boundary
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, no run poor shot this time, Wahab seems to have Clarke's beans going here. Just stood still and swiped across the line at fresh air
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, no run far calmer on this occasion with Clarke flagging one through outside off
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 1 run Afridi fluffs a regulation stop at mid-off but it was always going to be a single
Wahab Riaz to White, 1 run good run to bring up the Australia 100. White drops to point with soft hands and scoots through for a single
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, no run solid delivery to end the over, on a length at off stump and Clarke gives it the respect it deserves
Hafeez to White, no run nothing for White here as he pushes back to the bowler
Hafeez to White, no run White's hard hands unable to work the ball and he clunks to mid-on
Hafeez to White, no run again White is pinned to the crease as he pushes to leg
Hafeez to White, 1 leg bye unable to work singles White aims an almighty hack, can't connect but the ball springs off the pads for a single
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run Clarke is all wrists and quick feet as he picks off a single to deep square
Hafeez to White, no run White again clunks back to the bowler. Excellent work from Hafeez again
Afridi to Clarke, no run starts well by tossing it up a little, Clarke pushes wide of the bowler is search of a single but Afridi scoots around
Afridi to Clarke, 2 runs touch shorter and quicker and Clarke is back in a flash flicking into the leg side for a couple
Afridi to Clarke, no run Clarke is offered some width to drive at but is careful on the shot
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run this time he does pick up a single, flicking into space
Afridi to White, 1 run good hands from White here, finally, as he nudges to deep square
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run hint of spin from a shortish length, Clarke waits and then drives his bottom hand through the ball to send it from outside off stump down to long-on
Hafeez to Clarke, no run this keeps a little low, and Hafeez is nothing if not straight to Clarke defends
Hafeez to Clarke, 2 runs little bit short from the bowler and Clarke wheels away a pull shot
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run good follow-up, keeping the strike ticking by pushing down the ground
Hafeez to White, no run White can't match his partner's skills and picks out a fielder
Hafeez to White, 1 run big sweep heaved away this time, all along the ground to deep square
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run twinkle toes and quick wrists gets Clarke a single to long-on. When he plays well it's a treat watching Clarke play spin bowling
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run again Clarke skips down the wicket and flicks to midwicket
Afridi to White, 1 run if Clarke is all wrists, White is all forearms and offered some width here bludgeons the ball down the ground
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run little bit too short and Clarke drags it to long-on
Afridi to White, no run White tries to steal a single by dropping this towards point but he gets too much of it
Afridi to White, 2 runs in the end it looks a good shot but White would have been worried for a moment as he lifted this high down towards long off
Afridi to White, no run carefully defended to finish the over
Hafeez to Clarke, OUT chaos! White is run out in a terrible mix-up, a flick off the hip, Misbah swooped at short backward square, Akmal takes and the replay is conclusive!
Hafeez to Hussey, no run defended on the back foot
Hafeez to Hussey, 1 run pushed into the covers and an urgent, typically urgent, single
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run Clarke returns the compliment
Hafeez to Hussey, 1 run flicked off the toes to midwicket
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run Clarke steps back into the crease and pushes a single to mid-on
Afridi to Clarke, no run quicker delivery, strikes the thigh pad
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run a measured push to long-on
Afridi to Hussey, no run tapped out to cover, a good confident stride into the shot
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run full toss, but Clarke is too entrenched to take full toll. A push to long-on
Afridi to Hussey, 1 run one more scamper into the covers
Hafeez to Hussey, 1 run round the wicket, and tucked off the hip
Hafeez to Clarke, no run down the track but without much malice. Clipped to short midwicket
Hafeez to Clarke, 2 runs good use of the feet to cut hard down to third man, but more sharp work on the boundary's edge saves four
Hafeez to Clarke, 1 run clipped uppishly through square leg. It's slow going out there
Hafeez to Hussey, no run short and leg-sided. Hussey's ambitious smear doesn't come off as Akmal rushes round to field a deflection
Hafeez to Hussey, 1 run a soft-handed dab to cover. One more to the total
Abdur to Hussey, 1 run tapped to cover
Abdur to Clarke, 1 run clipped down to long-on
Abdur to Hussey, no run open-faced steer to gully, but can't beat the field
Abdur to Hussey, no run driven out to midwicket
Abdur to Hussey, 1 run sits up a touch outside off, Hussey jabs through the gap at point
Abdur to Clarke, 1 run another single threaded up to long-off. Australia living off scraps at the moment, just one boundary since Haddin's departure
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, 2 runs short, and spanked, up and over midwicket, but without much timing. Plops into no-man's land at cow corner
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, no run solidly forward, and defended
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, 1 run back of a length but targeting off. Driven with that peculiar hard-handed style down to third man

Abdul Razzaq to Johnson, OUT outside off, nipping off the seam, grazing the edge, and Johnson is gone for a duck! The extra bounce did the trick, and Akmal's glovework has been as good as ... well, ever, probably
Abdul Razzaq to Krejza, no run attempted yorker, good thinking, but drifting a touch down the leg-side. Steered to midwicket
Abdul Razzaq to Krejza, no run clear signs of reverse swing as Razzaq is really tearing in now. Defended solidly enough on off stump
Abdur to Smith, 1 run tapped into space to keep the score rolling
Abdur to Krejza, no run poked to cover from deep in the crease
Abdur to Krejza, no run defended back down the track
Abdur to Krejza, no run that beat everything, Akmal included. Missed stumping? Perhaps. Akmal's day had been too good to last
Abdur to Krejza, no run
Abdur to Krejza, no run blocked out to point, and the Aussie struggle continues
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, no run Smith is Australia's only hope. Imagine that. Pushed out to cover
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, no run Razzaq finding some kind of indrift and Smith pokes to midwicket
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, no run final 10 overs and Smith has to be very watchful and respectful in defence
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, 1 run steered down to third man, Smith seems so pleased with the shot he held the pose. With a technique as ugly as his that's a brave move
Abdul Razzaq to Krejza, no run Krejza stabs down on a straight ball
Abdul Razzaq to Krejza, no run Razzaq doing nothing more tricky than holding a line outside off stump. Where as this against Ross Taylor? Anyway, Krejza defends

Abdur to Smith, 1 run ooh, Smith gets in a woeful tangle top-edging an attempted dip over the keeper. It looped probably 10 metres behind Kamran but he had no interest in going for it. Still, he's held a few today
Abdur to Krejza, 1 run pushed away securely for a single
Abdur to Smith, no run Smith gets forward and defends with something approaching orthodoxy
Abdur to Smith, 2 runs Smith down on one knee and this time manages to dink his sweep more effectively which, combined with smart running earns him a couple
Abdur to Smith, 1 run carefully nudged to midwicket to bring Krejza, who has a first-class ton, on strike
Abdur to Krejza, 1 run toe-ended cut shot runs out to deep cover.
Abdul Razzaq to Clarke, no run clear signs of a two-paced pitch there, the ball died on impact and Clarke pulled at thin air
Abdul Razzaq to Clarke, no run defended with a hop into line, might have kept a bit low but Clarke hammed it up a touch
Abdul Razzaq to Clarke, no run poked in the air, straight back past the bowler, who nearly brushes his fingers on the ball as it thuds into the non-striker's stumps

Abdul Razzaq to Clarke, OUT that was coming all the way through that over. Clarke didn't look happy at Razzaq's box of tricks, and an attempted pull somehow wriggles through the stroke to dislodge the off bail
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, 2 runs a hard-handed poke outside off, the slip was there but he couldn't get close, though third man tidies up
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, no run an eventful introduction from the evergreen Razzaq. How long has he been around now?
Abdur to Hussey, 1 run pushed to midwicket, where Misbah again flings himself as if he's in the first flush of youth
Abdur to Smith, no run
Abdur to Smith, 1 run on the pads, flicked to midwicket
Abdur to Hussey, 1 run Hussey uses his feet, and eludes the diving Misbah at short midwicket
Abdur to Smith, 1 run tip and run from Smith, who finds space at point and scampers through
Abdur to Hussey, no run good aggression from the Pakistanis, a quick pick-up at short midwicket and a sharp shy to keep the non-striker honest

Umar Gul to Krejza, 1 run already some reverse swing, dipping into the batsman at 146kph. Some horrid stick-a-foot-out-and-hope fielding from Afridi gifts a single. He then stretches to take everyone's mind off what happens
Umar Gul to Smith, 1 run no swing from this length, hammered short and Smith jumps tall to drop by his feet and scoot for one
Umar Gul to Krejza, no run slip in place for Krejza but Gul admonishes himself for shoving down a short and wide one. Krejza is equally annoyed for missing it
Umar Gul to Krejza, 1 run this is a better ball, though curiously back of a length again. Krejza drops it to cover to exchange a single with Smith
Umar Gul to Smith, FOUR runs wow, this ferociously good timing this. Offered width Smith somehow ended up in a very conventional position to drive and it flew through the covers
Umar Gul to Smith, 1 run strange, only one yorker from that Gul over. This is a length delivery again and steered to third man
Afridi to Smith, 1 run Afridi brings himself back into the attack and almost squeezes through the defence but it bobbles off an edge
Afridi to Krejza, no run this is held back a touch and pushed into space
Afridi to Krejza, 1 run carefully worked away, much quicker delivery
Afridi to Smith, 2 runs dragged down a touch short and cut firmly out to deep point
Afridi to Smith, no run Smith ambles up the wicket and aims a whip to leg. Defeated by a touch of spin
Afridi to Smith, no run slower from Afridi, Smith guides to short third man
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, no run bounce from nowhere for Razzaq. Smith removes one hand from the handle to ride the lift on that one
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, no run forward cautiously and defended
Abdul Razzaq to Smith, 1 run excellent work once again from Pakistan. A quick pick-up at mid-on, and the shy from Younis hits the stumps. Not much excitement though, as Smith is well home
Abdul Razzaq to Hussey, no run beaten! That cut straight through Hussey, who was lucky not to inside-edge onto his own stumps
Abdul Razzaq to Hussey, no run drilled hard, more of a square drive than a cut, but point pouched it in an instant. Pakistan are so alert today!
Abdul Razzaq to Hussey, 1 run bashed down to long-on, another single to end another tight over
Abdur to Hussey, 1 run chiselled from outside off to midwicket. Another single
Abdur to Smith, 1 run tucked down to long on
Abdur to Hussey, no run reverse sweep, doesn't connect

Abdur to Hussey, OUT that's as soft as a baby possum. Hussey hardly got to the pitch of that one, and lobbed a simple chance to short midwicket. The two-paced wicket might take some of the blame, but that was poor from such an experienced campaigner
Abdur to Johnson, no run solidly forward, and defended to cover
Abdur to Johnson, no run subtle turn from outside the left-hander's off stump. Blocked solidly
Umar Gul to Krejza, 2 runs much too short and much too wide, this is poor stuff from Gul and Australia just building a decent run of play here. Krejza cuts out in front of deep cover for a couple
Umar Gul to Krejza, no run better, much better. More intent on this Gul delivery, firing it in fuller and sliding into Smith who couldn't work it away

Umar Gul to Krejza, OUT there it is! The Umar Gul inswinging yorker strikes again. Why did he wait so long? Krejza backed away to give himself room to pierce the off side but he missed and the stumps were shattered instead
Umar Gul to Lee, FOUR runs ooh, a second slip would have had it. As it is the outside edge flew wide of first slip and skimmed to the ropes. 200 must be Australia's target
Umar Gul to Lee, no run hooping, late reverse-swing at a full length would have burst through but for Lee's inside edge
Umar Gul to Lee, no run this one nips away and past an enquiring outside edge. Much better over from Gul that
Afridi to Smith, no run the field comes in and Smith picks out cover
Afridi to Smith, no run prodded back to the bowler
Afridi to Smith, 1 run little bit short but it's quickly onto the batsman who flips a single towards midwicket
Afridi to Lee, 1 wide speared a long way down the leg side
Afridi to Lee, 1 run googly finds the gloves as Lee defends with very low hands, there are no slips in place or catchers up to the crease so Lee can feel safe
Afridi to Smith, OUT Afridi strikes! Smith backs away to a googly that follows him and it crashes into middle stump
Afridi to Tait, no run full, flat, spearing yorker. Tait manages to jab a bat down
Umar Gul to Lee, no run this isn't a yorker but it's quick on a length, moving away and carefully blocked to cover
Umar Gul to Lee, no run that's the delivery that he's famed for! It snakes back so late homing in on the toes. Lee desperately clamps a bat down in time
Umar Gul to Lee, no run yorker followed by a short ball followed by a stare! Excellent bowling, this climbed past Lee
Umar Gul to Lee, OUT that's it! Australia slump to 176 all out - their lowest since 1992. Pakistan have a celebratory huddle! Lee aimed a swipe but it got high on the bat and looped to mid-off

Pakistan need 177 to win The last team to beat Australia in a World Cup have a fantastic opportunity to do it again. Australia were strangely tentative with the bat but before Pakistan fans celebrate too early, the pitch is touch on the slow side so the total is worth a little more. Not much though! Remember the winner tops Group A to
Kamran Akmal will face Lee, with two slips in place

Welcome back. It's been an historic day in Colombo. For the first time in 12 years, Australia have been bowled out in a World Cup game, and they face the very real prospect of defeat. It's been a two-paced track, however, and with a pace trio of Lee, Tait and Johnson, express pace and uneven bounce could yet turn the tables. Personall
Lee to Kamran, no run a beauty to start the innings, perfect line and length, and a nibble of late swing. Akmal swishes at thin air
Lee to Kamran, no run more swing under the floodlights, and that one doesn't get up either. Left alone, but already signs of that uneven bounce
Lee to Kamran, no run blocked on off stump, no swing this time as Akmal defends with an open face

Lee to Kamran, FOUR runs that's a hideous stroke, but they all count. An ugly cross-batted wave of the bat, more of a standing sweep than a full-blooded pull. A big top edge and none of the slips can get close!
Lee to Kamran, no run a mix-up in the middle of the pitch! Kamran flicks off his hip, and the batsmen almost shake hands while deciding whether to run. The shy goes wide
Lee to Kamran, no run stands firm in defence. A lively start!
Tait to Hafeez, no run a big effort, and a decent line. Outside off, through to the keeper
Tait to Hafeez, FOUR runs you can't bowl there to an opener! On the toes, flicked beautifully through square leg. No stopping that one
Tait to Hafeez, 1 run extra lift from a good length, strong wrists turn a single to fine leg
Tait to Kamran, 1 run three slips in place now as Akmal fences a single to third man
Tait to Hafeez, no run a swish and a miss, outside off, swinging late towards the slips. Good delivery
Tait to Hafeez, 1 wide that's the worst of Tait shortly after the best of him. An ugly bouncer, barely crosses the tramlines
Tait to Hafeez, no run and now he tightens his line again. Sharp
Lee to Kamran, 1 run banged into the hip, flicked to square leg
Lee to Hafeez, no run excellent carry from a tight line. Well left
Lee to Hafeez, no run full and straight, not quite a yorker, but attacking the stumps. Pushed to mid-off

Lee to Hafeez, OUT there it is! The breakthrough looked imminent, and so it was. A rapid delivery, Hafeez closed the face too early as he attempted to work a straight ball through midwicket, but a looping leading edge tempts Lee into a full-on sprint out of his follow-through, and he clings on to an excellent stretching take!
Lee to Shafiq, no run fast and full, strikes the pad but sliding down leg
Lee to Shafiq, 1 run a hint of width and slashed greedily through the vacant gully. Third man collects on the bounce. This is gripping viewing
Tait to Shafiq, 2 runs poor work from the skipper in the covers. A rare miss as Pakistan tipped and ran, and they were able to get back for two as his damaged left hand lets him down
Tait to Shafiq, no run fast again, and defended
Tait to Shafiq, no run a down-on-one-knee pile-drive of a stroke, but the ball is already in the keeper's gloves
Tait to Shafiq, 2 runs full and a fraction of swing, and that's tapped in front of square on the leg side
Tait to Shafiq, no run short, outside off, but that one dies on impact.
Tait to Shafiq, FOUR runs sumptuous from Shafiq, Tait's line wasn't all that bad, but the shot was timed to perfection from middle-and-leg, and no-one can intercept on the leg-side boundary!
Lee to Kamran, no run full, fast, swinging, hits the pads, a big appeal but Lee is late to join in. That was missing leg, and they don't bother to review
Lee to Kamran, no run this one holds its line on off stump and is pumped back to the bowler, who threatens to shy
Lee to Kamran, no run driven again, into the covers
Lee to Kamran, no run blocked on off stump, keeps a touch low, but Akmal gets the full face behind the line

Lee to Kamran, no run humungous appeal, and Ponting has gone for the review! Definitely closer than the last appeal, but it might remain an umpire's call. Hit deep in the crease but swinging, and that has clipped leg. Sure enough, it's not out
Lee to Kamran, no run straight as a die, back of a length, defended cautiously back to the bowler. Lee is bowling his socks off here
Johnson to Shafiq, 1 run good start from Johnson but an excellent early call to a soft-handed block
Johnson to Kamran, FOUR runs too much width and that's slapped hard through the covers. You can't bowl there etc ...
Johnson to Kamran, no run much better line, tight to off stump and threatening to swing back into the pads. Poked to point
Johnson to Kamran, no run banged in short, Akmal ducks
Johnson to Kamran, FOUR runs signs of swing, but it merely swings straight into the middle of Akmal's bat! Too much width again, and this is an expensive over in the context of a tight contest
Johnson to Kamran, no run better line, defended uneasily. A welcome over for Pakistan
Lee to Shafiq, 1 leg bye on the pads, deflected to short fine leg
Lee to Kamran, no run tight line, shaping from leg-and-middle towards off. Defended on the walk, back to the bowler
Lee to Kamran, no run short and defended on the hop, back to the bowler
Lee to Kamran, 1 run chopped down to third man
Lee to Shafiq, 1 run too full and clipped firmly to backward square
Lee to Kamran, no run driven out to cover, some of the menace was lacking in that Lee over.
Johnson to Shafiq, no run edged ... but good soft hands ensure that the ball dies long before it reaches first slip
Johnson to Shafiq, no run good from Johnson, lift off a good length, and defended out to point
Johnson to Shafiq, no run full, and driven up to mid-off. Not much sign of swing yet for Mitch
Johnson to Shafiq, no run outside off, left well alone
Johnson to Shafiq, no run firmly forward and driven into the covers. A composed stroke for no run
Johnson to Shafiq, FOUR runs too straight, tapped with a roll of the wrists through midwicket, where Tait can't pounce. A quick outfield and excellent timing. Mitch isn't happy
Lee to Kamran, FOUR runs misdirected, and worked superbly past short fine leg, but what's happened to Shafiq?
Lee to Kamran, no run a big inside-edge saves Akmal from a raucous lbw appeal! Full, fast and straight
Lee to Kamran, FOUR runs clobbered! Too short and wide, and Akmal loves the cut shot. That fizzed
Lee to Younis, no run lift on off stump, and defended to cover
Lee to Younis, no run sturdy defence on an off-stump line. The end of an incisive over. Can Australia find a man to back up Lee's efforts?
Johnson to Shafiq, no run full, but no swing. Pushed to cover
Johnson to Shafiq, no run outside off, whistling through, left alone
Johnson to Shafiq, no run a loose slash, that was a touch rash, though not the best ball Johnson has bowled. Too much width
Johnson to Shafiq, no run slower ball, defended from the crease
Johnson to Shafiq, no run crunched into the covers, can't pierce the field
Johnson to Shafiq, no run blocked solidly on off stump
Watson to Younis, no run starts with a creaky loosener on the pads but it's only nudged away
Watson to Younis, 1 run slip in place and rightly so, Watson finds some away-movement. Younis steers to point and hurries off for a single that was probably a little tighter then he expected
Watson to Shafiq, FOUR runs awful delivery, full and filthy down the leg side. Shafiq only had to tickle, and tickle he did
Watson to Shafiq, no run much better delivery, not hard to be I suppose, Shafiq blocks
Watson to Shafiq, 1 run another gimme served up on the pads, flicked away to deep square
Watson to Younis, no run Watson finds something close to off stump but Younis seemed to have an age to ease forward and defend
Johnson to Shafiq, 1 run Johnson is full and on middle, clipped around the corner
Johnson to Younis, 1 run oh dear, the pitch has quietened down but Pakistan's running is a shambles here. Dabbed to Hussey at point and a suicidal single would have been out with a direct hit
Johnson to Shafiq, 3 runs very neatly flicked off around middle to deep square. None of the other Aussie seamers have found the fire that Lee did
Johnson to Younis, no run better delivery outside off stump and left alone
Johnson to Younis, 1 run ooh, Younis would call it a steer, Johnson an edge. Either way it went past slip to third man to the annoyance of Johnson
Johnson to Shafiq, no run solid defence to end the over
Watson to Younis, 1 run Watson continues and continues badly. On the pads again at a gentle pace and Younis helps himself to a single at midwicket
Watson to Shafiq, 1 run bouncer banged in, big effort ball but crept up to Shafiq who swatted down to deep midwicket
Watson to Younis, no run better delivery here, full and straight and defended
Watson to Younis, no run Watson locates a good length and line again. Younis rewards him with defence
Watson to Younis, no run ah, bit of movement in the air. Swing of some description. Younis is again respectful in defence
Watson to Younis, no run very full and a touch of swing into the batsman. Driven to mid-on. Tidy end to the over but wickets are the only currency that counts with such a modest total to defend
Tait to Shafiq, no run grunts down a short and wide ball. It looked too short and too wide but the umpire let him be
Tait to Shafiq, no run he doesn't quite look at full throttle but the swing keeps the batsman honest. Which is a virtue
Tait to Shafiq, no run very fluid looking drive but it for no reward
Tait to Shafiq, no run good delivery this time, full and shaping into Shafiq who defends in a hurry
Tait to Shafiq, no run again the movement into the batsman causes trouble. Shafiq inside edging back to the bowler
Tait to Shafiq, no run full and fast. Blocked back to the bowler
Watson to Younis, no run starts very straight, looks like he's warmed into his task. Younis blocks back to him
Watson to Younis, no run hint of inswing but the line remains impeccable
Watson to Younis, 1 run nicely done from Younis, opening the face to send this down to third man
Watson to Shafiq, no run Watson is definitely finding inswing but at a very gentle pace and easily pushed to mid-on
Watson to Shafiq, 1 run this time the length is too short, the line too far down leg and it's clipped to deep square as a result
Watson to Younis, 1 run looked like Watson was attempting a bouncer, which at his pace is a touch ambitious. After waiting a while for the ball to arrive, it's wheeled to deep square
Tait to Younis, 1 wide fired down the leg side
Tait to Younis, no run this is straighter and Younis solidly defends
Tait to Younis, no run plenty of effort from Tait but without much reward. Even the pace is only 88mph. Younis has a while to get into line and defend
Tait to Younis, 3 runs the placement was better than the timing on this drive. Shafiq insisted on haring back for a third which looked dicey because he slipped as he turned but still makes it in time
Tait to Shafiq, 1 run full on the pads and Shafiq flicks with the angle to deep square
Tait to Younis, FOUR runs low full toss fired in and Younis bullets a drive back from where it came from. It can be difficult to time those but it raced to the fence
Tait to Younis, no run solid defence ends another over. The strike bowler just can't strike. Looks down on pace and a touch tired
Watson to Shafiq, no run not sure how Watson is going to make this breakthrough. These two look very solid against him
Watson to Shafiq, no run Shafiq eases a drive to cover without much timing
Watson to Shafiq, no run Ponting is fielding at silly mid-on. He collects a mistimed drive and pings back a throw at Haddin
Watson to Shafiq, 1 run looked like a slower ball, they are all fairly slow though. The line is wrong and it's tucked off the pads
Watson to Younis, no run very little pace of bounce in either the wicket or bowler. Driven to point
Watson to Younis, no run Watson looks to the heavens in disbelief that Younis should have middled a forward defence
Krejza to Shafiq, no run finds big spin first up, bit of bounce too and cramped Shafiq's cut
Krejza to Shafiq, no run big forward lunge outside off in response to smother the spin
Krejza to Shafiq, no run this delivery landed in the same place as the first but didn't turn at all. Variation?
Krejza to Shafiq, 1 run ooh, Shafiq leapt down the track and just turned his bat too early getting a leading edge to mid-off. Fair to say the spinner should have been one earlier
Krejza to Younis, no run Younis flows a drive to fall ball, really tried to smack it, but no timing
Krejza to Younis, no run ooh, short leg would have had it. As it is it bobbles off the gloves into space but an excellent start from Krejza
Watson to Shafiq, FOUR runs edged! But only for four, this proud record is slipping away for Australia! Wide of off, Shafiq aimed an expansive drive but it flew off the edge to take the target to 100
Watson to Shafiq, no run solid and sturdy defence to a full ball

Watson to Shafiq, no run again Shafiq is solidly forward. Ponting and Watson have some sort of discussion over where the catcher should be, didn't look particularly agreeable actually but Ponting has moved out of silly mid-on and posted a slip
Watson to Shafiq, no run another careful defence. After chancing his arm first ball, Shafiq is not going to again
Watson to Shafiq, 1 run bottom-handed flip towards midwicket earns a single
Watson to Younis, 1 run Watson should be grateful Clarke dived full-length at point to brush a hand on this or it would have been four. Dished up full and wide, Younis crashed a drive
Krejza to Younis, FOUR runs full toss and Younis take full toll. Driven back down the ground and Johnson made no real effort to catch up from long-on
Krejza to Younis, no run this time it's defended carefully
Krejza to Younis, no run tossed up again outside off, Younis stretches across to defend

Krejza to Younis, no run this pops off the glove into space where short leg could have been. Krejza asks his captain to post a man there, Australia need wickets in a hurry but still no short leg in place
Krejza to Younis, 1 run plenty of flight and Younis is again stretching into line but this time to flash a drive to deep point
Krejza to Shafiq, no run sharp spin from outside off is defended
Watson to Younis, no run full length, a touch of inswing, drilled hard to cover

Watson to Younis, FOUR runs streaky from Younis, it was a good ball and a loose stroke. I think it was an intentional dab through the cordon, but it flew uncomfortably close to Haddin. And the slip had only just been moved!
Watson to Younis, no run cautiously forward to defend
Watson to Younis, no run poked out to point
Watson to Younis, FOUR runs now that is a shot. The stroke of the day, a full and handsome drive through the covers. A bit of width, but what a majestic strike!
Watson to Younis, no run dabbed down to the gully, and that was a valuable over for Pakistan's cause
Krejza to Shafiq, no run two steps, and flicked to midwicket
Krejza to Shafiq, no run crease-bound this time, and wafted to midwicket again
Krejza to Shafiq, 1 run attacking line outside off, and always threatening to turn and bounce. Prodded in front of square on the leg side
Krejza to Younis, 2 runs an excellent shot, tossed up outside off, and confidently swept to deep square leg
Krejza to Younis, 1 run short but spinning, cut fiercely out to deep cover
Krejza to Shafiq, no run tossed up, and driven to cover. Good over, but the runs continue to come
Lee to Younis, 1 run banged in short but straight, fenced down to third man
Lee to Shafiq, no run back of a length again, defended to cover
Lee to Shafiq, 1 run flicked from a leg-stump line, another single to the cause
Lee to Umar Akmal, no run good ball but not enough for the hat-trick, attacking the stumps, and Umar defends from deep in the crease
Krejza to Shafiq, 1 run down on the sweep, and paddled square
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run looped up, and driven hard to cover
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 1 run splatted out to cow corner, an agriculturally elegant slog-sweep. Somehow it went along the ground all the way ...
Krejza to Shafiq, no run more orthodox this time
Krejza to Shafiq, no run down the leg side, but no wide called
Krejza to Shafiq, 1 run delicately dabbed round the corner, the sweep comes into play again
Lee to Shafiq, no run full and straight again, defended
Lee to Shafiq, 1 run attempted yorker comes out as a low full toss, punched to cover for an instant single
Lee to Umar Akmal, no run attacking length once again, but Umar still had a lot of time to play his drive.
Lee to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs battered! What a strike! Down on one knee, smeared on the up and through the covers! Fetch that
Lee to Umar Akmal, 2 runs whisked in the air through backward square. Umar wants to get this requirement gobbled up in a hurry, and it's probably not a bad policy
Lee to Umar Akmal, 1 run Lee pulls his length back for a decent rib-tickler, but a loose shy gifts Pakistan an overthrow - in fact it was Lee's errant boot which blasted the ball past the stumps!
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run outside off, swinging late, a missed back-cut
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run more swing for Johnson, and a limp poke outside off
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 2 runs squeezed off the pads, in front of square. Two more valuable runs
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 wide outside off, left alone
Johnson to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs more width, and Umar reaches for that, and finds the middle of the bat. In the air, but clears the ring ...
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run on the pads, clipped fine. Fine leg tidies up
Johnson to Shafiq, 1 run good running, a turn of the wrists and a quick call to short midwicket. Shafiq keeps the strike
Tait to Shafiq, no run short, but unthreatening. That's his one for the over
Tait to Shafiq, 1 run short again, outside off, dabbed off an under-edge out to gully. A sharp single brings Umar on strike, and the crowd shuffles forward in its seats ...
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run leg-stump line, not offering any room to swing the arms. Clipped to midwicket
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run humungous wind-up to a delivery that was fractionally outside off! That could have whizzed through midwicket. Instead it inside-edged onto his pads
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run stands tall, and drives hard to cover
Tait to Umar Akmal, 1 run low full toss, drilled into the gap at midwicket, Umar keeps the strike
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run solid defence on the line of off stump. That was almost as exaggerated as Andrew Flintoff's leather-sniffing block
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run a teaser outside off, Umar has a thrash. And misses
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run glided down to third man, just enough width to work with
Johnson to Shafiq, no run excellent delivery, outside off, holds its line and bursts past the edge
Johnson to Shafiq, no run this is an excellent over, Johnson's left-arm angle is cramping the Pakistanis' ambitions outside off
Johnson to Shafiq, 1 run edged but safe, down to third man
Tait to Shafiq, FOUR runs short, and that was ambitiously pulled, up and over midwicket. He needed a stepladder to play it comfortably, but fortune favoured the brave
Tait to Shafiq, no run solid defence, right behind the line
Tait to Shafiq, no run squeezed to cover
Tait to Shafiq, no run big stride, solid defence. None shall pass
Tait to Shafiq, no run a whistling bouncer, good decision to duck that one!
Tait to Shafiq, no run a crashing cut, straight to Clarke at point. Well intercepted, because that was travelling
Johnson to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs that's how Umar plays! One step down the track and walloped up and over cow corner!
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run outside off, and an almost comical leave-alone, given the flamboyance of the previous stroke
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run outside off again
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run flicked fine, square leg gathers
Johnson to Shafiq, no run elegant drive, straight to cover
Johnson to Shafiq, no run good delivery to finish, climbing towards off, and defended
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run toss it up outside off, that's what. Somehow Umar resists all his most base temptation and blocks
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run big spin here, starts outside off ends outside leg
Krejza to Umar Akmal, SIX runs didn't take Umar long! Sees the flight, dances down and hammers it up and over long-on for a maximum
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run now back to cautious defence, he's actually played this innings superbly
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 1 run tickled around the corner to exchange the strike
Krejza to Shafiq, no run Shafiq has played like a World Cup veteran in his second World Cup game
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run the only thing that has troubled Umar has been half-volleys and short balls from Johnson, oddly. This is short and wide but he fresh-airs a swish
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run having reasoned he can't seem to play without missing outside off Umar decides he won't play at all
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run calmly driven, but straight to cover

Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run couple of skips down the track but when he didn't get the half-volley he wanted Umar just nudged a single square of the wicket. That shot alone demonstrates how clearly he's thinking

Johnson to Shafiq, OUT a twist!? Surely not. But it is Pakistan, they're like England! Johnson removes the anchor Shafiq. Extra bounce clips the glove and heads towards slip, Haddin sprawls across to confuse the catcher but Watson's composure is intact and so it the catch!
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 1 run Krejza offers plenty of air to Umar but nothing silly attempted, that's the captain's job. Single nudged to midwicket
Krejza to Afridi, no run the crowd are heaving, expecting some Boom Boom. Instead Afridi pops forward and Boycotts a defence
Krejza to Afridi, 2 runs oh dear, Afridi is more sensible than the Australian fielders here. Carefully steers a single before Johnson overthrows to make it two
Krejza to Afridi, no run ooh, hint of leading edge sends it back to the bowler
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 1 run huge spin from outside off but Umar watches it carefully and keeps the strike by dabbing a single to midwicket
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run Johnson around the wicket to Umar, lands it outside off and Umar flags it through
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run picked off the hip to square leg

Johnson to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run oh, inside edge to the rescue. Just. Razzaq hanging deep in his crease to a pitched-up inswinger. Dreadful shot really, deserved to be out but somehow landed a faint inside edge down to fine leg
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run slower ball that Umar spots and steers past point, there's a bit of mix-up between the batsmen but eventually they cross for a single
Johnson to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run Razzaq has abandoned foot movement to play Johnson and looks all the more shaky for it. Dabbed without any conviction to midwicket
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run Umar solidly behind this
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run Krejza floats one up outside off and Razzaq steps confidently into a drive. Looks happier away from the pace
Krejza to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs dragged down short and despite a lot of turn Umar waits, picks a gap and powerfully cuts for four. The cut to the spinners can be dangerous but Umar played it superbly
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 1 run follows the boundary with a well-timed drive for a single. Pakistan fans will be breathing a little easier now
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, no run Razzaq pops forward to defend
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run Razzaq resists the temptation to swipe across the line and instead reaches for the textbook to drive a single to deep cover
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run smart and sturdy defence from Umar
Tait to Abdul Razzaq, no run goodness, this pitches and dies though to Haddin
Tait to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run absolutely nothing here for Tait, it's like he's bowling into a sandpit. Razzaq wants to be terrified - hanging back desperately - but the ball takes an age to reach him
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run ooh, Umar just rushed for pace here. Somehow Tait generated some life and a top-edged hook looped one-bounce to midwicket
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run having diced with death Umar reverts to discipline and leaves alone outside off
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run banged in short again, this time Umar gets up on his toes to deftly block it to point
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run not sure he needed to try this, stepping outside off to hack to leg. Ended up bottom-edging and it trickles away
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, no run much too short from Krejza but Razzaq misses out on the gift
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, no run wow, sharp, biting spin from outside off bursts through the gate to trap Razzaq on the pads. Big appeal but it was going over
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run worked with the spin into the leg side
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run tossed up and Umar stretches forward to defend
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run flash and a miss outside off! Umar just losing concentration as the target nears
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run worked to leg this time, much safer. Umar has done so well to get this far, just needs to work the singles now
Tait to Abdul Razzaq, 2 runs Tait and his off-colour day continues, full on the pads, Razzaq tickles a couple and the target is under 20 now!
Tait to Abdul Razzaq, 1 wide 18 to go as Tait slings a wide one outside off
Tait to Abdul Razzaq, no run this time Tait lands a quick one, sliding past the edge through to Razzaq
Tait to Abdul Razzaq, no run poor old Tait, he's busting his body to drag something out of the old ball and tired pitch but the short ball gets barely shin high
Tait to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run looked like an edge here! Fell just short of Haddin who fumbled the take to allow Razzaq through
Tait to Umar Akmal, 2 runs Tait lands a rapid yorker that Umar neatly, thoughtfully even, guides to third man for a well-run couple
Tait to Umar Akmal, no run flash and miss outside off! To be fair to Umar it was there to hit but for some reason he missed it
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, no run ooh, bottom-edge lands close to the stumps but Razzaq survives
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run better this time, guiding the ball with a straight bat to cover
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run Umar whips his bottom hand through the ball with the spin but picks out midwicket
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 1 run flicked firmly down the ground for a riskless single
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run Razzaq is attempting another cut and without quite timing it earns a single to cover
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 2 byes the turn and bounce beats everyone, including Haddin. Just jumped from a length and Haddin couldn't collect cleanly
Lee to Abdul Razzaq, no run ooh, already he's found something that Tait couldn't. It zips off the track and climbs past Razzaq's outside edge
Lee to Abdul Razzaq, no run good line from Lee, around off stump. Razzaq drives loosely but without alarm
Lee to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run smoothly driven through cover. Nine needed now and finally the heads are dropping. Ponting has been stroppy all tournament and looks thoroughly annoyed at the moment
Lee to Umar Akmal, 1 run slower ball, or at least the pitch made it a slower ball. Umar waits, nudes to leg and jogs through
Lee to Abdul Razzaq, no run still more hostility from Lee! Bangs in a short ball that climbs past Razzaq and crashes into Haddin's gloves
Lee to Abdul Razzaq, no run full-pitched to finish the over. Very straight too, but so was Razzaq's bat
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run finds really huge spin from a long way outside off, caught Umar by surprise but the batsman adjusted nicely to dab to point
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run driven off the back foot with the spin to mid-on
Krejza to Umar Akmal, no run tossed up outside off but Umar's drive is careful
Krejza to Umar Akmal, 1 run open-faced steer to point gives Umar a single and takes Pakistan even closer
Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, FOUR runs just one hit away now! Too short from Krejza and Razzaq gets deep into his crease to haul this through midwicket for four

Krejza to Abdul Razzaq, FOUR runs that's it! Australia's proud undefeated run in World Cups finally comes to an end. Razzaq creams this through cover, calmly tucks his bat under his arm and walks off! Comfortable win in the end and Pakistan top the group!

Umar is named man of the match for his unbeaten 44. Lee was probably the outstanding performer of the day but losers and losers. That's all from us - Sahil Dutta, Andrew Miller and Andrew McGlashan. India take on West Indies tomorrow which will decide the who plays who in the quarters.

Pakistan win by four wickets Umar can take a lot of credit for steering the chase home with an unbeaten 44. Shafiq set it up with a patient 46 but Brett Lee and Jason Krejza aside, Australia were impotent. Finally, after 34 games without defeat in the World Cup, Australia have been toppled. Intriguingly this sets up a likely clash bet
Pakistan won by 4 wickets (with 54 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Umar Akmal, PAK
